verses.plain: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.

tokens.t: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.

verses.plain: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.

tokens.t: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.

verses.plain: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool’s back.

tokens.t: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool’s back.

verses.plain: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.

tokens.t: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.

verses.plain: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.

tokens.t: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.

verses.plain: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.

tokens.t: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet,
drinketh damage.

verses.plain: The legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

tokens.t: The legs of the lame are not equal: so
a parable in the mouth of fools.

verses.plain: As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.

tokens.t: As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so
he that giveth honour to a fool.

verses.plain: As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

tokens.t: a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so
a parable in the mouth of fools.

verses.plain: The great God that formed all things both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors.

tokens.t: The great
that formed all
both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors.

verses.plain: As a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly.

tokens.t: As a dog returneth to his vomit,
a fool returneth to his folly.

verses.plain: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

tokens.t: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit?
more hope of a fool than of him.

verses.plain: The slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.

tokens.t: The slothful
saith,
a lion in the way; a lion
in the streets.

verses.plain: As the door turneth upon his hinges, so doth the slothful upon his bed.

tokens.t: the door turneth upon his hinges, so
the slothful upon his bed.

verses.plain: The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.

tokens.t: The slothful hideth his hand in
bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.

verses.plain: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.

tokens.t: The sluggard
wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.

verses.plain: He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.

tokens.t: He that passeth by,
meddleth with strife
not to him,
one that taketh a dog by the ears.

verses.plain: As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,

tokens.t: As a mad
who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,

verses.plain: So is the man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport?

tokens.t: So
the man
deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport?

verses.plain: Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out: so where there is no talebearer, the strife ceaseth.

tokens.t: Where no wood is,
the fire goeth out: so where
no talebearer, the strife ceaseth.

verses.plain: As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife.

tokens.t: coals
to burning coals, and wood to fire; so
a contentious man to kindle strife.

verses.plain: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

tokens.t: The words of a talebearer
as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

verses.plain: Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.

tokens.t: Burning lips and a wicked heart
a potsherd covered with silver dross.

verses.plain: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him;

tokens.t: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him;

verses.plain: When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart.

tokens.t: When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for
seven abominations in his heart.

verses.plain: Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before the whole congregation.

tokens.t: hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before the
congregation.

verses.plain: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.

tokens.t: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.

verses.plain: A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.

tokens.t: A lying tongue hateth
afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.

footnotes.text: bindeth…: or, putteth a precious stone in an heap of stones
The great…: or, A great man grieveth all, and he hireth the fool, he hireth also transgressors
returneth to his folly: Heb. iterateth his folly
it grieveth…: or, he is weary
speaketh…: Heb. maketh his voice gracious
